Crimes.Violation_Type: Failure to demonstrate intent to leave Canada after authorized stay
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the visa officer committed a reviewable error in rejecting the visa application
Crimes.Governing_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act (IRPA) s. 11(1), Regulations s. 179
Crimes.Application_Facts: Applicant lacked sufficient economic or family ties to India, no travel history, failed to meet burden of proof
Crimes.Court_Ruling: Federal Court dismissed the application for judicial review
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: Visa officer assessed applicant as high risk of overstaying
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged unreasonable decision by visa officer
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Reasonableness for factual assessments; correctness for procedural fairness
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Strength of economic and familial ties to home country
Crimes.Applicable_Legislation: IRPA s. 11(1), Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations s. 179
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: No interview conducted; deemed unnecessary under Guideline OP 11
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Applicant's intent to return to India not sufficiently demonstrated
Crimes.Evidence_Used: Lack of documented economic/family ties, absence of travel history
Crimes.Application_Basis: Applicant must prove they will leave Canada at the end of their stay
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: Ties to India, financial stability, travel history
Crimes.Relief_Sought: Overturn visa refusal through judicial review
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Applicants must satisfy officer they will depart Canada after temporary stay
Crimes.Evidentiary_Deficiency: Insufficient proof of strong ties to India
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: Risk of unauthorized residency in Canada
Crimes.Cause_Description: Visa applications denied due to insufficient evidence of intent to return to India
Crimes.Evidence_Handling: Visa officer reasonably evaluated available documents
Crimes.Evidence_Issues: Lack of supporting affidavits or documentation
Crimes.Residency_Compliance: Failure to demonstrate compliance with temporary residency conditions
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: Applicant did not meet burden of proof to show intent to return
Crimes.Decision_Making_Body: Visa Officer, Immigration, Refugees and Citizenship Canada (IRCC)

Crimes.Crime_Name: Failure to comply with Immigration and Refugee Protection Act requirements
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the visa officer made a reviewable error in refusing the application
Crimes.Governing_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act (IRPA) s. 11(1), Regulations s. 179
Crimes.Decision_Level: First-level administrative decision by visa officer
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Applicant failed to establish credible intent to return to India
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Documentary evidence of ties to home country
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Allegation of unreasonable refusal and procedural unfairness
Crimes.Evaluation_Standard: Standard of reasonableness applied to factual findings
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Lack of travel history and weak socio-economic ties to India
Crimes.Regulation_Cited: Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations s. 179
Crimes.Application_Error: Failure to provide required supporting affidavits
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Reasonableness for factual conclusions; correctness for procedural fairness
Crimes.Application_Factor: Burden on applicant to prove temporary intent
Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Existence of reviewable error in refusal
Crimes.Governing_Rule_or_Provision: IRPA s. 11(1): obligation to leave Canada after temporary stay
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: Insufficient evidence of intent to return to India
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Failure to file proper affidavits and supporting documents
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness: No breach found; no interview required under OP 11
Crimes.Credibility_Issues: Applicant’s claims not substantiated by evidence
Crimes.Jurisdictional_Focus: Canadian immigration law and Federal Court review
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Adequacy of procedural fairness in decision-making
Crimes.Omission_Type: Failure to submit required documentation and affidavits
Crimes.Grounds_for_Inadmissibility: Failure to meet admissibility requirements under s. 179
